creator: bjoern@syltonline.de
text:
Hi,
I know you might have tested your binary build, and there must be people out 
there where the JK is working. But I alos found more than a handful of people 
who got severe problems getting the jk 1.2.18 to run.
We got a win2k3 server system with a IIS6. In the moment, one web runs with 
the jk 1.2.14 and works fine. It's configured via the registry:
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Apache Software Foundation\Jakarta Isapi 
Redirector\1.0]
"log_file"="D:\\LOGFILES\\jk1\\JK1.2.1x_isapi.log"
"log_level"="info"
"worker_file"="D:\\Java\\Jakarta\\jk1\\conf\\workers.properties"
"worker_mount_file"="D:\\Java\\Jakarta\\jk1\\conf\\uriworkermap.properties"
"extension_uri"="/jakarta/isapi_redirect.dll"

so when we take that working config, and just swap the binary 
isapi_redirect.dll (1.2.14->1.2.18), it won't start.
The ISAPI FILTER for the web is marked red, Status: not loaded, Priority 
unknown (yes, I tried to use the web first), and in the eventlog of the 
machine, there is an event 2214 from W3SVC-WP, type error:

The HTTP Filter DLL D:\Java\Jakarta\jk1\bin\isapi_redirect.dll failed to 
load.  The data is the error.
Data: 0000: 02 00 00 00

There is no JK log or anything else I could think of I could provide here.
But feel free to ask for more information. Please help, because we need the 
1.2.18. he 1.2.14 is not too stable in heavy load environments.

This is already fixed in the SVN.
As a workaround add rewrite_map_file registry entry that points to
the empty file.

BTW, this was already explained both on tomcat dev and users list see:
http://www.mail-archive.com/users@tomcat.apache.org/msg15849.html
creator: mturk@apache.org

text: TYPO: Its a rewrite_rule_file, not rewrite_map_file!
creator: mturk@apache.org
bjoern@syltonline.de
text:
Thanks al lot Mladen Turk, that was quick. You are the hero of the day.

Btw, we use a lot of commercial software too. Very expsnsive stuff with even 
higher support bills. But the open source projects, especially apache related, 
offer by far the best and fastest support through the community.
Thanks lads and guys, you're doing great!
Move a couple of fixed JK issues from resolved to closed.
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
